relation: Vallandingham Gold Star for Valor Recipients
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {352=The Gold Star Award Program is administered by the Department of Rehabilitation and Correction's Office of Communications, 770 West Broad Street, Columbus, OH 43222. Please call (614) 752-1150., 6520=Last Updated: March 26, 2015}
textBeforeTable: 2015 Honorees The Gold Star Award Program is administered by the Department of Rehabilitation and Correction's Office of Communications, 770 West Broad Street, Columbus, OH 43222. Please call (614) 752-1150. The essay should also include the name and location of the employee/team being recommended and the recommending employee’s full name and location. Recommendations without this information will not be considered. The recommendation should be sent to the Office of Communications at Central Office. The decision regarding the award will be made by the Gold Star Selection Committee with notification to the submitter. Recommendation Process: An employee making a Gold Star recommendation must write a one page essay (not to exceed 500 words) explaining the reasons a particular person/team deserves a Gold Star Award. Although a single accomplishment may be deemed as qualifying an individual for this award, particular consideration should be given to those individuals who have contributed outstanding service on a sustained basis. The recommendation must include specifics of what the person/team has done. Their actions must be beyond the scope of normal duties to be considered. Provided support and contributed to the mission of the Department been selected by the Director The Director of the Ohio Department of Rehabilitation and Correction may present the Gold Star Award to a non-Department person, group, organization or agency that has Team has significantly improved an existing process Team has developed a cost
